A quadratic residue modulo n is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo n. In this case, we are looking for quadratic residues modulo 7.

We will check the squares of the integers from 0 to 6 (since we are working modulo 7) and reduce them modulo 7.

0^2 ≡ 0 (mod 7)
1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 7)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 7)
3^2 ≡ 9 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
4^2 ≡ 16 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
5^2 ≡ 25 ≡ 4 (mod 7)
6^2 ≡ 36 ≡ 1 (mod 7)

So, the quadratic residues modulo 7 are {0, 1, 2, 4}.
